<P STYLE="margin-top:3px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The aggregate market value of the voting stock held by non-affiliates of the registrant as of December&nbsp;31, 2010, the last business
day of the registrant&#146;s second fiscal quarter, was approximately $9,887,665 (based on the closing price reported on such date by the NASDAQ Global Market of the registrant&#146;s Common Stock). Shares of Common Stock held by officers and
directors and holders of 10% or more of the outstanding Common Stock have been excluded from the calculation of this amount because such persons may be deemed to be affiliates. This determination of affiliate status is not necessarily a conclusive
determination for other purposes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:3px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of September&nbsp;7, 2011, the number of outstanding shares of the registrant&#146;s
Common Stock was 23,068,649. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:0px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PART&nbsp;I </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Item&nbsp;1.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Business. </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>This report
contains certain forward-looking statements that involve risks, uncertainties and assumptions that are difficult to predict. Words and expressions reflecting optimism, satisfaction or disappointment with current prospects, as well as words such as
&#147;believes,&#148; &#147;hopes,&#148; &#147;intends,&#148; &#147;estimates,&#148; &#147;expects,&#148; &#147;projects,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148; &#147;anticipates&#148; and variations thereof, or the use of future tense, identify forward-looking
statements, but their absence does not mean that a statement is not forward-looking. Such forward-looking statements are not guarantees of performance and our actual results could differ materially from those contained in such statements. In
evaluating such statements we urge you to specifically consider various factors identified in this report, including the matters set forth under the heading &#147;Risk Factors&#148; in Part&nbsp;I, Item&nbsp;1A of this report, any of which could
cause actual results to differ materially from those indicated by such forward-looking statements. Forward-looking statements speak only as of the date of this report and we undertake no obligation to publicly update any forward-looking statements
to reflect new information, events or circumstances after the date of this report. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Overview </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We are a trusted global provider of unified data management and data protection solutions designed to enable small and medium enterprises
(&#147;SMEs&#148;), corporate departments, and small and medium businesses (&#147;SMBs&#148;) to anticipate and respond to change. Whether an organization&#146;s data is distributed around the corner or across continents, our solutions consolidate
and categorize data for easy and cost-effective management of different tiers of information over time. We enable companies to expend fewer resources on information technology (&#147;IT&#148;) allowing them to focus on being more responsive to the
needs of their customers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We develop and deliver a comprehensive solution set of award-winning products
and services for moving and storing data throughout the organization and during the entire data lifecycle. Our Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> product is a complete line of network attached storage (&#147;NAS&#148;) and storage area network
(&#147;SAN&#148;) solutions designed to ensure primary and secondary data is accessible and protected regardless of its location. Our Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> solutions are available with backup, replication and mirroring software in fixed capacity or highly scalable configurations. These solutions provide simplified
disk-based data protection and maximum flexibility to protect mission critical data for both continuous local backup and remote disaster recovery. Our NEO SERIES<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> and REO SERIES<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> of virtual
tape libraries, tape backup and archive systems are designed to meet the need for cost-effective, reliable data storage for long-term archiving and compliance requirements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our approach emphasizes long term investment protection for our customers and reduces the complexities and ongoing costs associated with storage management. Moreover, most of our products are designed
with a scalable architecture which enables companies to purchase additional storage as needed, on a just-in-time basis, and make it available instantly without downtime. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">End users of our products include SMEs, SMBs, distributed enterprise companies such as divisions and operating units of large multi-national corporations, governmental organizations, and educational
institutions. Our products are used in a broad range of industries including financial services, video surveillance, healthcare, retail, manufacturing, telecommunications, broadcasting, research and development and many others. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We sell our solutions worldwide in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East and Africa (&#147;EMEA&#148;) and the Asia Pacific
(&#147;APAC&#148;) region. We generate sales through: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">our branded channel, which consists of commercial distributors direct market resellers and value-added resellers (&#147;VARs&#148;); and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">private label arrangements with an original equipment manufacturer (&#147;OEM&#148;), Hewlett-Packard Company (&#147;HP&#148;), which in the fourth
quarter of fiscal 2011, we fulfilled all our obligations under the agreement for supply of tape libraries; however, we will continue to provide spares and services under the agreement. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We were incorporated in California in 1980 as Overland Data,&nbsp;Inc., and changed our name
to Overland Storage,&nbsp;Inc. in 2002. Our headquarters is located at 9112 Spectrum Center Boulevard, San Diego, California 92123, and our telephone number is (858)&nbsp;571-5555. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Our Direction and Strategy </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In today&#146;s business environment, we
believe that improving productivity and effectively managing your digital assets while controlling operating expenses has become one of the top priority for organizations worldwide. At the same time, we believe that the cost and complexity of
managing vital information has risen exponentially. As a result of these opposing forces, we believe that many companies find themselves lacking the essential resources and expertise required to adequately manage information across their businesses
and they continue to spend a significant portion of their time and money tying isolated islands of data together. Without an effective alternative to mitigate the cost and complexity of traditional approaches, their data simply cannot be effectively
shared and sufficiently protected. We provide solutions designed to deliver enterprise features with the simplicity that allows organizations to reduce the cost of managing and protecting their information. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our comprehensive data storage and protection solutions enable IT managers to easily and cost effectively share and preserve data across
their organization and provide continuous access, automated data movement between multiple locations and reduced backup windows for improved business continuity. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We estimate that the cost of managing digital assets is four times the cost of acquiring storage devices.
Furthermore, many SMEs and SMBs are seeking to implement tiered storage for primary and secondary data utilizing a combination of low cost Serial Advanced Technology Attachment (&#147;SATA&#148;) drives and high performance Serial Attached SCSI
(&#147;SAS&#148;) drives. The International Data Corporation (&#147;IDC&#148;) estimates that the total NAS market will grow at approximately 12.6% through 2014, and the growth rate for NAS storage systems in price bands up to $15,000, where most of
our Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> solutions lie, is estimated to be 17.4%. According to IDC, tape storage still constitutes
approximately 7.3% of the total storage revenue in the global storage market. Sales of tape automation appliances represented 37.7% and 46.6% of our revenue during fiscal 2011 and 2010, respectively. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Our Products and Services </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our data management and data protection solutions provide SMEs, SMBs, enterprise departments and branch offices with disk-based systems
for primary or nearline storage, disk backup and recovery, and software for data management and protection. For long-term storage requirements, we offer automated tape solutions for tape backup and archive. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Data Management Software </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our GuardianOS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> storage-optimized platform OS is designed for Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> NAS devices to deliver simplified data management and consolidation throughout distributed IT
environments. Combining cross-platform file sharing with block-level data access on a single device, the
GuardianOS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> platform provides a flexible solution for storage infrastructures. In addition to a unified storage
architecture, the GuardianOS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> platform offers scalability through features such as Instant Capacity Expansion
(&#147;I.C.E.&#148;), centralized storage management and a comprehensive suite of data protection tools. The flexibility and scalability of GuardianOS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> reduces the total cost of ownership of storage infrastructures. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Snap Enterprise Data Replicator<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> (&#147;Snap EDR&#148;)
provides multi-directional, WAN-optimized replication for Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> systems. With Snap EDR, administrators
can automatically replicate data between multiple Snap Servers for data distribution, data consolidation, or data protection. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Protection OS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> software provides virtualization, data
protection, data management and connectivity features for REO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> virtual tape library (&#147;VTL&#148;) systems.
With our Protection OS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> software, administrators can </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
implement REO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> appliances in a wide variety of storage and
backup environments. The Protection OS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> software is compatible with all major operating systems, popular backup
software solutions and iSCSI networks and Fibre Channel networks. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>SnapSAN<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> Storage Area Network Solutions </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> products provide block-based primary storage for virtual server environments and low latency applications. Systems can be managed through intuitive management
interfaces that employ guided wizards to facilitate easy installation and administration. Our SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> products
also offer a powerful set of features including auto provisioning, mirroring for high availability, replication and snapshots for data protection. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT>
S1000 is a 2U with iSCSI, Fibre Channel, or SAS host connections, designed for providing non-stop services to the most demanding applications. The SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> S1000 can be configured to utilize high capacity SATA II drives for up to 24 terabytes, or high performance SAS drives for up to 7.2 terabytes, with maximum
scalability using Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> E1000 enclosures up to 120 terabytes. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT>
S2000 is a 2U iSCSI SAN appliance designed for high performance and simple, straight-forward administration. The
SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> S2000 can be configured with up to 12 SATA II drives for 12 terabytes or 24 terabytes of storage
capacity; or 12 high performance SAS drives for 3.6 terabytes or 7.2 terabytes of storage capacity. SATA and SAS drives can also be intermixed in the S2000 for increased flexibility. The SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> S2000 can be scaled to 192 terabytes by adding up to seven Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> E2000 Expansion enclosures. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> Network-Attached Storage Solutions </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> family is an ideal platform for primary or nearline storage. With a full range of appliances, from compact, portable desktop systems to highly scalable rackmount
systems, the Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> line delivers proven stability and best-in-class integration with Windows, UNIX/Linux,
and Macintosh environments. For virtual servers and database applications, the Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> family supports
iSCSI block-level access with Microsoft VSS and VDS integration to simplify Windows management. For data protection, the Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> family offers replication, snapshots for point-in-time recovery and the ability to back up to disk, VTL,
or tape. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Rackmount Systems </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 410 and N2000 are rack-mountable systems intended for the server room or data center. The rackmount
systems provide higher performance and capacity than desktop systems and are designed for data consolidation. The Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 410 is a 1U server configured with four SATA II drives for 4 terabytes or 8 terabytes of storage
capacity and supports RAID levels 0, 1, 5, 6, and 10. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

storage capacity or 12 high performance SAS drives for up to 7.2 terabytes of storage capacity. SATA and SAS drives can also be intermixed in the Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP

Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> N2000 can be scaled to 144 terabytes by adding up to five Snap Server<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> E2000 Expansion enclosures and supports RAID levels 0, 1, 5, 6, and 10. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Desktop System </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 210 is designed for easy set up and maintenance
and is an ideal solution for branch and remote offices or departments that do not have dedicated IT personnel. These systems provide network accessible storage and cost effective data protection in a compact, portable, desktop storage unit. The Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 210 is configured with two SATA II drives for a total of 2 terabytes or 4 terabytes of storage capacity
and supports RAID levels 0 and 1. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>REO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> Virtual Tape Library Solutions </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our REO SERIES<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> VTL solutions provide best-in-class disk-based
backup and recovery. Systems can be configured as virtual tape libraries, standalone virtual tape drives, and/or disk volumes, or LUNs. Powered by our REO Protection OS<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> software, our REO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> system
includes a unique feature known as dynamic virtual tape which provides more efficient and cost-effective disk storage than other competitive products on the market. REO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> solutions are compatible with all popular open systems or Windows-based backup software, physical tape drives or tape libraries and connect easily to iSCSI Ethernet
networks for seamless integration into existing backup environments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The REO<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 4600 is a 2U rackmount VTL designed for high performance, scalable backup and recovery. The REO<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 4600 can be configured with 12 SATA II drives for 12 terabytes or 24 terabytes of storage capacity. The REO<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 4600 can be scaled to 120 terabytes by adding up to four Snap
Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> E2000 Expansion enclosures and supports RAID levels 5 and 6. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Tape Based Backup and Long Term Archive Solutions </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> Series Tape Libraries and Autoloaders are designed for small and medium businesses looking for simple, cost-effective data protection or a complex enterprise
environment with stringent performance and data availability requirements. We provide a complete range of high capacity, high performance, flexible tape-based solutions for data backup, recovery and archive. When combined with our Snap Server<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> systems, our NEO SERIES<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> products create a complete disk-to-disk-to-tape solution with a variety of storage capacity options. The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> tape solutions can accommodate up to 24 tape drives and 1,000 cartridges for maximum efficiency and data protection. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> S
Series provides affordable, expandable tape backup for small and medium-sized businesses. The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> S libraries
incorporate the latest linear tape-open (&#147;LTO&#148;) technologies, as well as SCSI, SAS and FC connectivity. The
NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 200s is a 2U tape library that supports up to 24 cartridge slots and 2 tape drives. The NEO<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 400s is a 4U tape library that supports up to 48 cartridge slots and 4 tape drives, with the option to expand to a
total of 96 cartridges and 6 tape drives. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> E
Series provides scalable, high capacity, data-center class tape automation that is ideal for large businesses. The
NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> E systems incorporate the latest LTO technologies as well as redundant robotics, partitioning capability,
mail slot access and SCSI, SAS and FC connectivity. The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 2000e is a 5U tape library that supports up to 30
cartridge slots and 2 tape drives. The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 4000e is a 10U tape library that supports up to 60 cartridge slots
and 4 tape drives. The NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 2000e and NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 4000e modules can be combined to provide a maximum capacity of up to 240 cartridge slots and 16 tape drives. The
NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 8000e is a 43U tape library that supports up to 500 cartridge slots and 12 tape drives in a single module,
scalable to 1,000 cartridge slots and 24 tape drives. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Customers </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our solution-focused product offerings are designed specifically for SMEs, corporate departments, and SMBs. We sell all of our products
through our worldwide distributor and reseller network. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All of our products and services are designed and manufactured to
address enterprise customer requirements and reliability standards. The following provides additional detail on our channels: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Distribution channel</I></B>&#151;Our primary distribution partners in North America include Synnex Corporation, Ingram Micro Inc. and Promark
Technology. We have approximately 20 distribution partners throughout Europe and Asia. Typically, distributors sell our products to system integrators, VARs and direct marketing resellers (&#147;DMRs&#148;), who in turn sell to end users. We support
these distributors through our dedicated field sales force and field engineers. No distributor accounted for more than 10% of net revenue for fiscal 2011 and 2010. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Reseller channel</I></B>&#151;Our reseller channel includes systems integrators, VARs and DMRs. Our resellers frequently package our products as
part of a complete data processing system or with other storage devices to deliver a complete storage subsystem. Our resellers sometimes recommend our products as replacement solutions when backup systems are upgraded or bundle our products with
storage management software specific to the end user&#146;s system. We support the reseller channel through our dedicated field sales representatives, field engineers and technical support organizations. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>OEM channel</I></B>&#151;Our OEM channel was based upon our supply agreement with HP, which incorporated our NEO products into its tape backup
offerings. During the fourth quarter of fiscal 2011, we fulfilled all our obligations under the agreement for supply of tape libraries; however, we will continue to provide spares and services under the agreement. HP product revenue, including
spares, accounted for 10.3% and 18.3% of sales in fiscal 2011 and 2010, respectively. HP total revenue accounted for 18.8% and 22.5% of net revenues in fiscal 2011 and 2010, respectively. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We divide our worldwide sales into three geographical regions: </FONT></P>

literature and application notes. We also offer lead generation opportunities and market development funds to key channel partners. Our sales management and engineering personnel provide support to the channel partners and visit potential customer
sites to demonstrate the technical advantages of its products. We maintain press relations in the United States and Europe, and we participate in national and regional trade shows worldwide. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Customer Service and Support </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Customer service and support are key elements of our strategy and critical components of our commitment to making enterprise-class support and services available to companies of all sizes. Our technical
support staff is trained to assist our customers with deployment and compatibility for any combination of hardware platforms, operating systems and backup, data interchange and storage management software. Our application engineers assist with more
complex customer issues. We maintain global toll-free service and support phone lines and we also provide self-service and support through our website support portal and email. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In November 2009, we introduced the OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> program for select products, providing next business day advance delivery of customer replaceable parts and next business day onsite installation of non-customer
replaceable parts. In July 2011, we introduced the enhanced OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> service offering for our entire line
of SnapServer<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> NAS, SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT>, NEO Series<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> tape products
and REO Series<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> VTL solutions. OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> offers new onsite service and installation options, round-the-clock phone access to solution experts, as well as proof of concept and architectural design offerings.
The expanded OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> program strengthens our ability to provide comprehensive technical assistance on a
global scale. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following details the warranties we currently offer on our major products: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">three-year advance replacement OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> Level 1 limited warranty on our REO
SERIES<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> and SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> products; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">one-year advance replacement OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP

NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 200s, NEO<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">one-year on-site by next business day service OverlandCare<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP

STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> 8000e products. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Research and
Development </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We incurred company-sponsored research and development costs of $7.7 million and $5.8
million in fiscal 2011 and 2010, representing 10.9% and 7.5% of net revenue, respectively. In fiscal 2011, we continued to augment our product lines by expanding our hardware platforms and feature enhancements to our software. Noteworthy product
releases for fiscal 2011 included the SnapSAN<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&#153;</SUP></FONT> S1000, a 2U 12-bay iSCSI SAN appliance; and GOS 6.5, an
important revision to our Snap Server<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;</SUP></FONT> operating system. Our plans for fiscal 2012 include a number of hardware
and software enhancements across all of our products. Particular areas of focus are the introduction of the next generation enterprise storage software, performance, ease of use, and deeper integration between our product lines. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Manufacturing and Suppliers </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We perform product assembly, integration and testing at our integrated factory in San Diego, California. We purchase servers, tape drives, chassis, printed circuit boards, integrated circuits, and all
other major components from outside suppliers. We carefully select suppliers based on their ability to provide quality parts and components which meet technical specifications and volume requirements. We actively monitor these suppliers but we are
subject to substantial risks associated with the performance of our suppliers. For certain components, we qualify only a single source, which magnifies the risk of shortages and decreases our ability to negotiate with that supplier. See &#147;If our
suppliers fail to meet our manufacturing needs, it would delay our production and our product shipments to customers and negatively affect our operations&#148; under the heading &#147;Risk Factors&#148; in Part I, Section&nbsp;1A of this report. We
had $0.1 million and $0.4 million of firm backlog orders at June&nbsp;30, 2011 and 2010, respectively. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We occupied our
current headquarters and manufacturing buildings in March&nbsp;2002. On July&nbsp;1, 2010, we modified our San Diego headquarters lease and reduced our facility by one building, or 67,285 square feet, which proportionally reduced our monthly base
rent and share of facility expenses. The building is subject to a 12-year </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
lease with one five-year extension option. Currently we have the capacity to support unit production levels several times greater than the current rate of production. In order to accommodate
normal business fluctuations and control staffing levels carefully to meet customer requirements at any time, we augment our direct labor force by employing temporary staff from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Competition </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The worldwide storage market is highly competitive.
Competitors vary in size from small start-ups to large multi-national corporations which may have substantially greater financial, research and development and marketing resources. In the tape automation market, we believe our primary competitors
are International Business Machines Corporation (&#147;IBM&#148;), Dell Inc. and Quantum Corporation. Key competitive factors include product features, reliability, durability, scalability and price. Barriers to entry in tape automation are
relatively high. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our primary disk-based platform competitors are EMC Corporation (both branded EMC and Iomega division),
NetGear, Inc., NetApp, Inc., HP, IBM, and Dell Inc. Key competitive factors in these markets include performance, functionality, scalability, availability, interoperability, connectivity, time to market enhancements and total value of ownership.
Barriers to entry for disk-based backup products are low. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The markets for all of our products are characterized by
significant price competition and we anticipate that our products will continue to face price pressure. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Proprietary Rights </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>General</B>&#151;We presently hold 30 United States patents and we have 10 United States patents pending. In general, these patents
have a 20-year term from the first effective filing date for each patent. The patents that are material to our business will begin to expire in November 2015. We also hold a number of foreign patents and patent applications for certain of our
products and technologies. These rights, however, may not prevent competitors from developing products substantially equivalent or superior to our products. In addition, our present and future patents may be challenged, invalidated or circumvented,
reducing or eliminating our proprietary protection. We continue to be diligent about maintaining our patent portfolio and monitoring potential infringement of our patents. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>VR<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">2</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;
</SUP></FONT>&nbsp;Technology</FONT></B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#151;We have entered into various intellectual property licensing agreements relating to our VR</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">2</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;
</SUP></FONT>&nbsp;technology. These agreements require the payment of royalty fees based on sales by licensees of products containing our VR</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">2</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&reg;
</SUP></FONT> technology. </FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Employees </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of June&nbsp;30, 2011, we had 195 full-time employees and 2 part-time employees, including 78 in sales and marketing, 41 in research and development, 49 in manufacturing and operations and 29 in
finance, information systems, human resources and other management. There are no collective bargaining contracts covering any of the employees and we believe that our relationship with our employees is good. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Financial Information about Segments and Geographic Areas </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We operate our business in one reportable segment. For information about our revenues from external customers, measures of profits, losses and total assets, and our revenues from external customers and
long-lived assets broken down by geographic area, see Note 1 (Operations and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&#151;&#147;Segment Data&#148; and &#147;Information about Geographic Areas&#148;) to our consolidated financial statements.
